abstract: The frame of the dragging item.
overview:
## Discussion

The dragging frame provides the spatial relationship between [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingItem] instances when you set the dragging formation to [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingFormation/none].

The exact coordinate space of this rectangle depends on where you use it. Examples are the view that initiates the drag using [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/beginDraggingSession(with:event:source:)] or the view you pass to the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingSession] implementation of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingSession/enumerateDraggingItems(options:for:classes:searchOptions:using:)].

# draggingFrame

**Instance Property**

The frame of the dragging item.

## Declaration

```swift
var draggingFrame: NSRect { get set }
```

## Discussion

The dragging frame provides the spatial relationship between [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingItem] instances when you set the dragging formation to [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingFormation/none].

The exact coordinate space of this rectangle depends on where you use it. Examples are the view that initiates the drag using [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/beginDraggingSession(with:event:source:)] or the view you pass to the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingSession] implementation of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingSession/enumerateDraggingItems(options:for:classes:searchOptions:using:)].

## Dragging frame

- **setDraggingFrame(_:contents:)**: Sets the item’s dragging frame and contents.

items.description: Sets the item’s dragging frame and contents.
